RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA] OF 392-1051.
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic tail;
RX   PubMed=14621295; DOI=10.1093/dnares/10.4.167;
RA   Okazaki N., Kikuno R., Ohara R., Inamoto S., Koseki H., Hiraoka S.,
RA   Saga Y., Nagase T., Ohara O., Koga H.;
RT   "Prediction of the coding sequences of mouse homologues of KIAA gene:
RT   III. The complete nucleotide sequences of 500 mouse KIAA-homologous
RT   cDNAs identified by screening of terminal sequences of cDNA clones
RT   randomly sampled from size-fractionated libraries.";
RL   DNA Res. 10:167-180(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Deubiquitinase involved in DNA damage response
CC       checkpoint and MYC proto-oncogene stability. Involved in DNA
CC       damage induced apoptosis by specifically deubiquitinating proteins
CC       of the DNA damage pathway such as CLSPN. Also involved in G2 DNA
CC       damage checkpoint, by deubiquitinating CLSPN, and preventing its
CC       degradation by the anaphase promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C).
CC       In contrast, it does not deubiquitinate PLK1. Specifically
CC       deubiquitinates MYC in the nucleoplasm, leading to prevent MYC
CC       degradation by the proteasome: acts by specifically interacting
CC       with FBXW7 (FBW7alpha) in the nucleoplasm and counteracting
CC       ubiquitination of MYC by the SCF(FBXW7) complex (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Thiol-dependent hydrolysis of ester,
CC       thioester, amide, peptide and isopeptide bonds formed by the C-
CC       terminal Gly of ubiquitin (a 76-residue protein attached to
CC       proteins as an intracellular targeting signal).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with FBXW7; following DNA damage, dissociates
CC       from FBXW7 leading to degradation of MYC.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nucleoplasm {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q5I043-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q5I043-2; Sequence=VSP_015581;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- PTM: Degradaded upon nickel ion level or hypoxia exposure.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated upon DNA damage at Ser-67 and Ser-720, by ATM
CC       or ATR. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the peptidase C19 family. USP28 subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 UIM (ubiquitin-interacting motif) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 USP domain. {ECO:0000305}.

RT   "The transcriptional landscape of the mammalian genome.";
RL   Science 309:1559-1563(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the anaphase promoting complex/cyclosome
CC       (APC/C), a cell cycle-regulated E3 ubiquitin ligase that controls
CC       progression through mitosis and the G1 phase of the cell cycle.
CC       The APC/C complex acts by mediating ubiquitination and subsequent
CC       degradation of target proteins: it mainly mediates the formation
CC       of 'Lys-11'-linked polyubiquitin chains and, to a lower extent,
CC       the formation of 'Lys-48'- and 'Lys-63'-linked polyubiquitin
CC       chains (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein ubiquitination.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: V-shaped homodimer. Interacts with CDC26. The mammalian
CC       APC/C is composed of 14 distinct subunits that assemble into a
CC       complex of at least 19 chains with a combined molecular mass of
CC       around 1.2 MDa. Interacts with PPP5C and CDC20 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13042}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: TPR repeats 1-7 mediate homodimerization, while the C-
CC       terminal TPR repeats bind to CDC26, burying its hydrophobic N-
CC       terminus. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13042}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated. Phosphorylation on Ser-560 occurs
CC       specifically during mitosis (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the APC6/CDC16 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 14 TPR repeats. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00339}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAB28717.1; Type=Miscellaneous discrepancy; Note=Intron retention.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May act as a scaffolding protein within caveolar
CC       membranes, functionally participating in formation of caveolae or
CC       caveolae-like vesicles.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterooligomeric complex of flotillin-1 and flotillin-2
CC       and caveolin-1 and caveolin-2. Interacts with ECM29 (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Peripheral membrane protein.
CC       Membrane, caveola; Peripheral membrane protein. Melanosome
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Endosome {ECO:0000250}. Note=Membrane-associated
CC       protein of caveolae.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: High expression in brain, white adipose
CC       tissue, heart muscle, skeletal muscle and lung. Low expression in
CC       spleen, liver and testis.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Expression increases at least 10-fold as 3T3-L1
CC       cells differentiate into adipocytes.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the band 7/mec-2 family. Flotillin
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RT   "LUMA interacts with emerin and influences its distribution at the
RT   inner nuclear membrane.";

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May have an important role in maintaining nuclear
CC       envelope structure by organizing protein complexes at the inner
CC       nuclear membrane. Required for retaining emerin at the inner
CC       nuclear membrane. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18230648}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Can form oligomers through the transmembrane domains.
CC       Interacts with EMD; the interaction retains EMD at the inner
CC       nuclear membrane. Interacts with LMNA and LMNB2. Interacts with
CC       SUN2 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum. Nucleus inner
CC       membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein. Note=Retained in the inner
CC       nuclear membrane through interaction with EMD and A- and B-lamins.
CC       The N- and C-termini are oriented towards the nucleoplasm. The
CC       majority of the hydrophilic domain resides in the endoplasmic
CC       reticulum lumen.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TMEM43 family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Kinesin is a microtubule-associated force-producing
CC       protein that may play a role in organelle transport. The light
CC       chain may function in coupling of cargo to the heavy chain or in
CC       the modulation of its ATPase activity (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Oligomeric complex composed of two heavy chains and two
CC       light chains. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton {ECO:0000305}.

RX   PubMed=12711551; DOI=10.1016/S1567-133X(02)00067-4;
RA   Zhao F., Lufkin T., Gelb B.D.;
RT   "Expression of Tfap2d, the gene encoding the transcription factor Ap-2
RT   delta, during mouse embryogenesis.";
RL   Gene Expr. Patterns 3:213-217(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Sequence-specific DNA-binding protein that interacts
CC       with inducible viral and cellular enhancer elements to regulate
CC       transcription of selected genes. AP-2 factors bind to the
CC       consensus sequence 5'-GCCNNNGGC-3' and activate genes involved in
CC       a large spectrum of important biological functions including
CC       proper eye, face, body wall, limb and neural tube development.
CC       They also suppress a number of genes including MCAM/MUC18, C/EBP
CC       alpha and MYC. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11522791, ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Binds DNA as a dimer. Can form homodimers or heterodimers
CC       with other AP-2 family members. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11522791}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in both embryonic and newborn brain.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11522791}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expression is first detected at E9.5 in the
CC       central nervous system and the developing heart. The signal
CC       detected in heart persists through to E10.5. Diffusely expressed
CC       in developing brain at E10.5 to E11.5, but by E13.5 expression is
CC       mostly confined to the midbrain and forebrain. Also expressed in
CC       the spinal cord at E10.5, and in retinal epithelium from E13.5 to
CC       E16.5. No signals detected in tissues such as the neural crest,
CC       facial mesenchyme, and limbs where other Tfap2 genes are
CC       expressed. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12711551}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the AP-2 family. {ECO:0000255}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May link EHMT1 and EHMT2 histone methyltransferases to
CC       the CTBP corepressor machinery. May be involved in EHMT1-EHMT2
CC       heterodimer formation and stabilization.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16702210}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Part of a complex containing at least CDYL, REST, WIZ,
CC       SETB1, EHMT1 and EHMT2 (By similarity). Interacts with EHMT1,
CC       EHMT2, CTBP1 and CTBP2. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16702210}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16702210}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=4;
CC       Name=L;
CC         IsoId=O88286-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=S;
CC         IsoId=O88286-2; Sequence=VSP_024954;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=O88286-3; Sequence=VSP_024953, VSP_024956, VSP_024958;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=O88286-4; Sequence=VSP_024955, VSP_024957;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: According to PubMed:9795207, isoform L and
CC       isoform S are brain-specific. According to PubMed:16702210,
CC       isoform S is ubiquitously expressed. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16702210,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9795207}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Isoform L and isoform S are expressed in
CC       brain from E14 to adulthood, with highest levels in the perinatal
CC       period. At embryonic stages, isoform L seems to be excluded from
CC       cerebellum. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9795207}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The C2H2-type zinc finger 10 mediates interaction with
CC       EHMT1 and EHMT2.
CC   -!- POLYMORPHISM: C57BL/6J and C57BR/cdJ mice specifically present an
CC       insertion of a type II early transposon in the opposite
CC       orientation into exon 6. This results in a strong reduction in the
CC       protein levels of isoform L.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the krueppel C2H2-type zinc-finger protein
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 10 C2H2-type zinc fingers.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00042}.

RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;

RT   "The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA
RT   project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).";
RL   Genome Res. 14:2121-2127(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Integrin alpha-6/beta-4 is a receptor for laminin. It
CC       plays a critical structural role in the hemidesmosome of
CC       epithelial cells. Is required for the regulation of keratinocyte
CC       polarity and motility (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of an alpha and a beta subunit. Beta-4
CC       associates with alpha-6. Interacts (via cytoplasmic region) with
CC       COL17A1 (via cytoplasmic region). Interacts (via cytoplasmic
CC       region) with DST isoform 3 (via N-terminus). Interacts (via
CC       cytoplasmic domain) with DST (via N-terminus). Interacts with RAC1
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000250}; Single-pass
CC       type I membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Cell membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Lipid-anchor {ECO:0000250}. Cell junction,
CC       hemidesmosome {ECO:0000250}. Note=Colocalizes with DST at the
CC       leading edge of migrating keratinocytes. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=A2A863-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=A2A863-2; Sequence=VSP_037636;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=A2A863-3; Sequence=VSP_037636, VSP_037637;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The fibronectin type-III-like domains bind BPAG1 and
CC       plectin and probably also recruit BP230. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Palmitoylated by DHHC3 at several cysteines of the membrane-
CC       proximal region, enhancing stability and cell surface expression.
CC       Palmitoylation also promotes secundary association with
CC       tertaspanins (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the integrin beta chain family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 Calx-beta domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 4 fibronectin type-III domains.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00316}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PSI domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 VWFA domain. {ECO:0000305}.

RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;

RN   [9]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.9 ANGSTROMS) OF 1-494, REPEATS, SUBCELLULAR
RP   LOCATION, AND MUTAGENESIS OF TYR-284 AND 272-PHE--ARG-280.
RX   PubMed=23499022; DOI=10.1016/j.str.2013.02.006;
RA   Bilokapic S., Schwartz T.U.;
RT   "Structural and functional studies of the 252 kDa nucleoporin ELYS
RT   reveal distinct roles for its three tethered domains.";
RL   Structure 21:572-580(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for the assembly of a functional nuclear pore
CC       complex (NPC) on the surface of chromosomes as nuclei form at the
CC       end of mitosis. May initiate NPC assembly by binding to chromatin
CC       and recruiting the Nup107-160 subcomplex of the NPC. Also required
CC       for the localization of the Nup107-160 subcomplex of the NPC to
CC       the kinetochore during mitosis and for the completion of
CC       cytokinesis (By similarity). Has also been proposed to function as
CC       a transcription factor which may play a specific role in
CC       hematopoietic tissues (PubMed:11952839). {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11952839}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Associates with the Nup107-160 subcomplex of the NPC.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Chromosome, centromere, kinetochore
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, nucleoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus,
CC       nuclear pore complex. Nucleus matrix. Cytoplasm. Note=Localizes to
CC       the nuclear pore complex (NPC) throughout interphase. Localizes to
CC       the kinetochore from prophase, and this appears to require the
CC       Nup107-160 subcomplex of the NPC. Localizes to the periphery of
CC       chromatin from late anaphase (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed with higher expression in
CC       testis, lung and kidney. Expressed in T-cells, B-cells and
CC       granulocytes in bone marrow. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11952839}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed throughout the embryo at E3.5 and
CC       E6.5. Higher expression is detected at 10.5 dpc nad then
CC       progressively decreases. Highly expressed in fetal hematopoietic
CC       tissues including liver, spleen and thymus. Expressed in the
CC       endothelium lining the dorsal aorta of 11.5 dpc embryos (at
CC       protein level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11952839,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15507119}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The N-terminus forms a highly conserved seven-bladed beta
CC       propeller decorated with long loops and mediates anchorage to the
CC       Nup107-160 subcomplex of the nuclear pore, synergistically with
CC       the central alpha domain. The disordered C-terminus is responsible
CC       for the interactions with chromatin (PubMed:23499022).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23499022}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Embryonic lethality before E7.5. Impaired
CC       proliferation of the inner cells of the blastocyst due at least in
CC       part to increased apoptosis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15507119}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ELYS family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 A.T hook DNA-binding domain. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic brain;
RX   PubMed=15345747; DOI=10.1074/mcp.M400085-MCP200;

RN   [6]
RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-134, AND IDENTIFICATION
RP   BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RX   PubMed=19144319; DOI=10.1016/j.immuni.2008.11.006;
RA   Trost M., English L., Lemieux S., Courcelles M., Desjardins M.,
RA   Thibault P.;
RT   "The phagosomal proteome in interferon-gamma-activated macrophages.";
RL   Immunity 30:143-154(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Interacts with phosphorylated C-terminal heptapeptide
CC       repeat domain (CTD) of the largest RNA polymerase II subunit
CC       POLR2A, and participates in dephosphorylation of the CTD.
CC       Transcriptional regulator which enhances expression of CCND1.
CC       Promotes binding of RNA polymerase II to the CCDN1 promoter and to
CC       the termination region before the poly-A site but decreases its
CC       binding after the poly-A site. Prevents RNA polymerase II from
CC       reading through the 3' end termination site and may allow it to be
CC       recruited back to the promoter through promotion of the formation
CC       of a chromatin loop. Also enhances the transcription of a number
CC       of other cell cycle-related genes including CDK2, CDK4, CDK6 and
CC       cyclin-E but not CDKN1A, CDKN1B or cyclin-A. Promotes cell
CC       proliferation (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Associates with the RNA polymerase II complex.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9CSU0-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9CSU0-2; Sequence=VSP_018618, VSP_018619;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q9CSU0-3; Sequence=VSP_035576, VSP_035577;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed in the adult with highest
CC       levels in liver, colon, prostate and uterus and lowest levels in
CC       heart and kidney. Not detected in rectum.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22264791}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Highly expressed during early embryonic
CC       development (at protein level). Low levels detected in the adult.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22264791}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the UPF0400 (RTT103) family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 CID domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00724}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-154, AND IDENTIFICATION BY
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Signaling adapter that couples activated growth factor
CC       receptors to signaling pathways. Participates in signaling
CC       downstream of the angiopoietin receptor TEK/TIE2, and plays a role
CC       in the regulation of endothelial cell migration and sprouting
CC       angiogenesis (By similarity). Participates in a signaling cascade
CC       initiated by activated KIT and KITLG/SCF. Isoform p47Shc and
CC       isoform p52Shc, once phosphorylated, couple activated receptor
CC       kinases to Ras via the recruitment of the GRB2/SOS complex and are
CC       implicated in the cytoplasmic propagation of mitogenic signals.
CC       Isoform p47Shc and isoform p52 may thus function as initiators of
CC       the Ras signaling cascade in various non-neuronal systems. Isoform
CC       p66Shc does not mediate Ras activation, but is involved in signal
CC       transduction pathways that regulate the cellular response to
CC       oxidative stress and life span. Isoform p66Shc acts as a
CC       downstream target of the tumor suppressor p53 and is indispensable
CC       for the ability of stress-activated p53 to induce elevation of
CC       intracellular oxidants, cytochrome c release and apoptosis. The
CC       expression of isoform p66Shc has been correlated with life span.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12571362,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17272725}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with the NPXY motif of tyrosine-phosphorylated
CC       IGF1R and INSR in vitro via the PID domain. Once activated, binds
CC       to GRB2. Interacts with tyrosine-phosphorylated DDR2 and CD3T.
CC       Interacts with the N-terminal region of APS. Interacts with GRB7
CC       and KIT (By similarity). Interacts with PTK2/FAK1 (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with phosphorylated LRP1 and IRS4. Interacts with FLT4
CC       (tyrosine-phosphorylated) (By similarity). Interacts with PDGFRB
CC       (tyrosine-phosphorylated). Interacts with ERBB4 (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with TEK/TIE2 (tyrosine-phosphorylated) (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with ALK, GAB2, TRIM31, INPP5D/SHIP1 and INPPL1/SHIP2.
CC       Interacts with PTPN6/SHP (tyrosine phosphorylated). Identified in
CC       a complex containing FGFR4, NCAM1, CDH2, PLCG1, FRS2, SRC, SHC1,
CC       GAP43 and CTTN. Interacts with EPHB1 and GRB2; activates the
CC       MAPK/ERK cascade to regulate cell migration. Interacts with the
CC       Trk receptors NTRK1, NTRK2 and NTRK3; in a phosphotyrosine-
CC       dependent manner. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10068665,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10080542, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10395202,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11433297, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12367511,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12925710, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19665990,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8643691, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8654924,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9083021, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9099679,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9885561}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P0DMN7:Amd1; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-644529;
CC       Q60631:Grb2; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-1688;
CC       Q9JKF1:Iqgap1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-644633;
CC       P35831:Ptpn12; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-2642957;
CC       Q9Z179:Shcbp1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-644352;
CC       Q64729:Tgfbr1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1019301, EBI-2899393;
CC       Q62312:Tgfbr2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1019301, EBI-2899332;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform p47Shc: Mitochondrion matrix
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Targeting of isoform p47Shc to mitochondria is
CC       mediated by its first 32 amino acids, which behave as a bona fide
CC       mitochondrial targeting sequence. Isoform p52Shc and isoform
CC       p66Shc, that contain the same sequence but more internally
CC       located, display a different subcellular localization (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform p66Shc: Mitochondrion
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17272725}. Note=In case of oxidative
CC       conditions, phosphorylation at 'Ser-36' of isoform p66Shc, leads
CC       to mitochondrial accumulation.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing, Alternative initiation; Named isoforms=3;
CC         Comment=In human, it is alternative promoter usage that produces
CC         such isoforms.;
CC       Name=p66Shc; Synonyms=p66;
CC         IsoId=P98083-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=p52Shc; Synonyms=p52;
CC         IsoId=P98083-2; Sequence=VSP_018791;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative splicing.;
CC       Name=p47Shc; Synonyms=p47;
CC         IsoId=P98083-3; Sequence=VSP_018792;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative initiation at Met-46 of isoform
CC         p52.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed. Expressed in neural stem
CC       cells but absent in mature neurons.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: In response to a variety of growth factors, isoform p47Shc
CC       and isoform p52 bind to phosphorylated receptors through their
CC       phosphotyrosine binding (PID) and/or SH2 domains. The PID and SH2
CC       domains bind to specific phosphorylated tyrosine residues in the
CC       Asn-Pro-Xaa-Tyr(P) motif. Isoform p47Shc and isoform p52Shc are in
CC       turn phosphorylated on three tyrosine residues within the extended
CC       proline-rich domain. These phosphotyrosines act as docking site
CC       for GRB2 and thereby are involved in Ras activation.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated in response to FLT4 signaling (By similarity).
CC       Tyrosine phosphorylated by ligand-activated PDGFRB (By
CC       similarity). May be tyrosine phosphorylated by activated PTK2/FAK1
CC       (By similarity). Tyrosine phosphorylated by TEK/TIE2 (By
CC       similarity). Tyrosine phosphorylated by activated PTK2B/PYK2 (By
CC       similarity). Dephosphorylation by PTPN2 may regulate interaction
CC       with GRB2 (By similarity). Phosphorylated by activated epidermal
CC       growth factor receptor. Phosphorylated in response to KIT
CC       signaling. Isoform p47Shc and isoform p52Shc are phosphorylated on
CC       tyrosine residues of the Pro-rich domain. Isoform p66Shc is
CC       phosphorylated on Ser-36 by PRKCB upon treatment with insulin,
CC       hydrogen peroxide or irradiation with ultraviolet light. FLT3
CC       signaling promotes tyrosine phosphorylation of isoform p47Shc and
CC       isoform p52Shc. Also tyrosine phosphorylated by ligand-activated
CC       ALK. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10080542,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9165038}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PID domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00148}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 SH2 domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00191}.

RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;

RT   "The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA
RT   project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).";
RL   Genome Res. 14:2121-2127(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the specific attachment of an amino acid to
CC       its cognate tRNA in a 2 step reaction: the amino acid (AA) is
CC       first activated by ATP to form AA-AMP and then transferred to the
CC       acceptor end of the tRNA.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + L-aspartate + tRNA(Asp) = AMP +
CC       diphosphate + L-aspartyl-tRNA(Asp).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; also part of a multisubunit complex that
CC       groups AIMP1, AIMP2, EEF1A1 and tRNA ligases for Arg, Asp, Glu,
CC       Gln, Ile, Leu, Lys, Met and Pro.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   INVOLVEMENT IN SUSCEPTIBILITY TO SEVERE INFLUENZA INFECTION.
RX   PubMed=22446628; DOI=10.1038/nature10921;
RA   Everitt A.R., Clare S., Pertel T., John S.P., Wash R.S., Smith S.E.,
RA   Chin C.R., Feeley E.M., Sims J.S., Adams D.J., Wise H.M., Kane L.,

RN   [16]
RP   GENE FAMILY.
RX   PubMed=22363774; DOI=10.1371/journal.pone.0031961;
RA   Sallman Almen M., Bringeland N., Fredriksson R., Schioth H.B.;
RT   "The dispanins: a novel gene family of ancient origin that contains 14
RT   human members.";
RL   PLoS ONE 7:E31961-E31961(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: IFN-induced antiviral protein which inhibits the entry
CC       of viruses to the host cell cytoplasm, permitting endocytosis, but
CC       preventing subsequent viral fusion and release of viral contents
CC       into the cytosol. Active against multiple viruses, including
CC       influenza A virus, SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Marburg virus
CC       (MARV) and Ebola virus (EBOV), Dengue virus (DNV), West Nile virus
CC       (WNV) and human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1). Can
CC       inhibit: influenza virus hemagglutinin protein-mediated viral
CC       entry, MARV and EBOV GP1,2-mediated viral entry and SARS-CoV S
CC       protein-mediated viral entry. Plays a critical role in the
CC       structural stability and function of vacuolar ATPase (v-ATPase).
CC       Establishes physical contact with the v-ATPase of endosomes which
CC       is critical for proper clathrin localization and is also required
CC       for the function of the v-ATPase to lower the pH in phagocytic
CC       endosomes thus establishing an antiviral state. Involved in
CC       initiating germ cell competence and specification, and in the
CC       demarcation of PGCs from their somatic neighbors.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12124616, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18505827,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21253575, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22467717}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with SPP1; the interaction reduces OPN
CC       expression (By similarity). Interacts with ATP6V0B and CD81.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16395393,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22467717}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Single-pass type II membrane
CC       protein. Late endosome membrane {ECO:0000250}; Single-pass type II
CC       membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Lysosome membrane {ECO:0000250};
CC       Single-pass type II membrane protein {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in acinar cell. Predominantly
CC       expressed in nascent primordial germ cells, as well as in gonadal
CC       germ cells. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12659663,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15184081}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: At E7.25 strong expression is found at the
CC       base of the incipient allantois and weak expression in the
CC       mesodermal portion of the posterior amnion, and, importantly, the
CC       expression did not extend to the allantois. Expression persisted
CC       until the late bud stage (E7.5), but gradually faded around the
CC       early head fold stage (E7.75). At an earlier stage, only weak
CC       expression is seen throughout the epiblast in E6.0. But around
CC       E6.25-E6.5 (before gastrulation), marked expression is evident
CC       within the most proximal layer of the epiblast that is in intimate
CC       contact with the extraembryonic ectoderm. Expression is indeed
CC       induced by extraembryonic ectoderm through signaling molecules.
CC       During germ cell formation, is expressed in putative PGC ancestors
CC       in embryos at 6.5-7.5 dpc. In migrating PGCs, expression is
CC       continuous. After the beginning of gastrulation, the expression
CC       migrates to the posterior end of the developing primitive streak
CC       at the early/mid streak stage and became very intense in the
CC       position where PGCs (Primordial germ cells) differentiate from
CC       late streak stage onward. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12124616,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:14516695, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16326387}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By alpha interferon. Induced in pancreas during
CC       caerulein-induced pancreatitis. Induced in pancreas under
CC       systemic-lipopolysaccharide treatment and in intestine under
CC       Salmonella infection. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15184081}.
CC   -!- PTM: Polyubiquitinated with both 'Lys-48' and 'Lys-63' linkages.
CC       Ubiqutination negatively regulates antiviral activity. Lys-24 is
CC       the most prevalent ubiquitination site (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the CD225/Dispanin family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: It has been previously shown that mediates migration of
CC       early primordial germ cells (PGCs) (PubMed:16326387). But
CC       according to PubMed:16326387, have no detectable effects on
CC       development of the germ line or on the generation of live young,
CC       hence, is not essential for PGC migration.
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:16326387}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Vesicular soluble NSF attachment protein receptor (v-
CC       SNARE) mediating vesicle docking and fusion to a specific acceptor
CC       cellular compartment. Functions in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi
CC       transport; as part of a SNARE complex composed of GOSR1, GOSR2 and
CC       STX5. Functions in early/recycling endosome to TGN transport; as
CC       part of a SNARE complex composed of BET1L, GOSR1 and STX5. Has a
CC       S-palmitoyl transferase activity (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Identified in 2 different SNARE complexes; the first one
CC       composed of GOSR1, GOSR2 and STX5 and the second one composed of
CC       BET1L, GOSR1 and STX5. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytosol {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Cytoplasmic vesicle membrane {ECO:0000250}; Lipid-anchor
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000250}. Golgi apparatus
CC       membrane {ECO:0000250}; Lipid-anchor {ECO:0000250}; Cytoplasmic
CC       side {ECO:0000250}. Note=Probably cycles through vesicles between
CC       Golgi and endosomes. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The longin domain regulates palmitoylation and membrane

RN   [7]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.93 ANGSTROMS) OF 37-193 IN COMPLEX WITH
RP   PHOSPHATIDYLINOSITOL 5-PHOSPHATE, AND MUTAGENESIS OF GLU-73; GLU-76;
RP   ASP-101 AND CYS-132.
RX   PubMed=21730175; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1109290108;
RA   Xiao J., Engel J.L., Zhang J., Chen M.J., Manning G., Dixon J.E.;
RT   "Structural and functional analysis of PTPMT1, a phosphatase required
RT   for cardiolipin synthesis.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 108:11860-11865(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Lipid phosphatase which dephosphorylates
CC       phosphatidylglycerophosphate (PGP) to phosphatidylglycerol (PG).
CC       PGP is an essential intermediate in the biosynthetic pathway of
CC       cardiolipin, a mitochondrial-specific phospholipid regulating the
CC       membrane integrity and activities of the organelle. Has also been
CC       shown to display phosphatase activity toward phosphoprotein
CC       substrates, specifically mediates dephosphorylation of
CC       mitochondrial proteins, thereby playing an essential role in ATP
CC       production. Has probably a preference for proteins phosphorylated
CC       on Ser and/or Thr residues compared to proteins phosphorylated on
CC       Tyr residues. Probably involved in regulation of insulin secretion
CC       in pancreatic beta cells (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylglycerophosphate + H(2)O =
CC       phosphatidylglycerol + phosphate.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Protein tyrosine phosphate + H(2)O = protein
CC       tyrosine + phosphate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10044}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: [a protein]-serine/threonine phosphate + H(2)O
CC       = [a protein]-serine/threonine + phosphate.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Phospholipid metabolism; phosphatidylglycerol
CC       biosynthesis; phosphatidylglycerol from CDP-diacylglycerol: step
CC       2/2.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Mitochondrion inner membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16039589}. Note=Associated with the inner
CC       membrane.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Predominantly expressed in testis. Expressed
CC       at lower level in heart, brain, spleen, lung, liver, skeletal
CC       muscle, kidney, bone marrow, eye, lymph node, smooth muscle,
CC       prostate, thymus, stomach and uterus.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15247229}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Mice die prior to E8.5.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21641550}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the protein-tyrosine phosphatase family.
CC       Non-receptor class dual specificity subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 tyrosine-protein phosphatase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Was originally (PubMed:15247229) thought to have
CC       phosphatidylinositol 5-phosphatase activity, however, it was later
CC       shown (PubMed:16039589) that it is probably not the case in vivo.
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:15247229, ECO:0000305|PubMed:16039589}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAH26750.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally shortened.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=BAB28400.1; Type=Frameshift; Positions=36; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=BAB29504.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally shortened.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 376-386, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=OF1; TISSUE=Hippocampus;
RA   Lubec G., Sunyer B., Chen W.-Q.;
RL   Submitted (JAN-2009) to UniProtKB.
RN   [4]
RP   FUNCTION, AND INTERACTION WITH GIT1.
RX   PubMed=18523162; DOI=10.1096/fj.07-094086;
RA   Cavet M.E., Pang J., Yin G., Berk B.C.;
RT   "An epidermal growth factor (EGF) -dependent interaction between GIT1
RT   and sorting nexin 6 promotes degradation of the EGF receptor.";
RL   FASEB J. 22:3607-3616(2008).
RN   [5]
RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND INTERACTION WITH CDKN1B.
RX   PubMed=20228253; DOI=10.1096/fj.09-138255;
RA   Fuster J.J., Gonzalez J.M., Edo M.D., Viana R., Boya P., Cervera J.,
RA   Verges M., Rivera J., Andres V.;
RT   "Tumor suppressor p27(Kip1) undergoes endolysosomal degradation
RT   through its interaction with sorting nexin 6.";
RL   FASEB J. 24:2998-3009(2010).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in several stages of intracellular trafficking.
CC       Interacts with membranes phosphatidylinositol 3,4-bisphosphate
CC       and/or phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate (Probable). Acts in
CC       part as component of the retromer membrane-deforming SNX-BAR
CC       subcomplex. The SNX-BAR retromer mediates retrograde transport of
CC       cargo proteins from endosomes to the trans-Golgi network (TGN) and
CC       is involved in endosome-to-plasma membrane transport for cargo
CC       protein recycling. The SNX-BAR subcomplex functions to deform the
CC       donor membrane into a tubular profile called endosome-to-TGN
CC       transport carrier (ETC). Does not have in vitro vesicle-to-
CC       membrane remodeling activity (By similarity). Involved in
CC       retrograde endosome-to-TGN transport of lysosomal enzyme receptor
CC       IGF2R. May function as link between transport vesicles and
CC       dynactin. Negatively regulates retrograde transport of BACE1 from
CC       the cell surface to the trans-Golgi network. Involved in E-
CC       cadherin sorting and degradation; inhibits PIP5K1C-mediated E-
CC       cadherin degradation (By similarity). In association with GIT1
CC       involved in EGFR degradation (PubMed:18523162). Promotes lysosomal
CC       degradation of CDKN1B (PubMed:20228253). May contribute to
CC       transcription regulation (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UNH7, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18523162,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20228253}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms heterodimers with BAR domain-containing sorting
CC       nexins SNX1 and SNX2. The heterodimers are proposed to self-
CC       assemble into helical arrays on the membrane to stabilize and
CC       expand local membrane curvature underlying endosomal tubule
CC       formation. Thought to be a component of the originally described
CC       retromer complex (also called SNX-BAR retromer) which is a
CC       pentamer containing the heterotrimeric retromer cargo-selective
CC       complex (CSC), also descibed as vacuolar protein sorting
CC       subcomplex (VPS), and a heterodimeric membrane-deforming
CC       subcomplex formed between SNX1 or SNX2 and SNX5 or SNX6 (also
CC       called SNX-BAR subcomplex); the respective CSC and SNX-BAR
CC       subcomplexes associate with low affinity (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with SNX1, SNX2, VPS26A, VPS29, VPS35, TGFB receptors,
CC       BACE1, BRMS1, PIP5K1C. Interacts with DCTN1; the association with
CC       DCTN1 is involved in movement of retromer-c ontaining vesicles
CC       toward the TGN. Interacts with PIM1; translocating SNX6 to the
CC       nucleus (By similarity). Interacts with CDKN1B and GIT1
CC       (PubMed:18523162, PubMed:20228253). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UNH7,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18523162, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20228253}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Early endosome membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20228253}; Peripheral membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20228253}; Cytoplasmic side
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20228253}. Cytoplasmic vesicle
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UNH7}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UNH7}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UNH7}. Note=Interaction with SNX1 or SNX2
CC       promotes location at endosome membranes (By similarity). Only a
CC       minor proportion is seen in the nucleus (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UNH7}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The PX domain mediates interaction with membranes enriched
CC       in phosphatidylinositol 3,4-bisphosphate and/or
CC       phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The BAR domain is able to sense membrane curvature upon
CC       dimerization. Membrane remodeling seems to implicate insertion of
CC       an amphipatric helix (AH) in the membrane (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UNH7}.
CC   -!- PTM: In vitro phosphorylated by PIM1; not affecting PIM1-dependent
CC       nuclear translocation (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UNH7}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the sorting nexin family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 BAR domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PX (phox homology) domain.

RN   [3]
RP   INTERACTION WITH TERF1.
RX   PubMed=19487455; DOI=10.1083/jcb.200812121;
RA   Zhu Q., Meng L., Hsu J.K., Lin T., Teishima J., Tsai R.Y.;
RT   "GNL3L stabilizes the TRF1 complex and promotes mitotic transition.";
RL   J. Cell Biol. 185:827-839(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the shelterin complex (telosome) that is
CC       involved in the regulation of telomere length and protection.
CC       Shelterin associates with arrays of double-stranded TTAGGG repeats
CC       added by telomerase and protects chromosome ends; without its
CC       protective activity, telomeres are no longer hidden from the DNA
CC       damage surveillance and chromosome ends are inappropriately
CC       processed by DNA repair pathways. Plays a role in shelterin
CC       complex assembly (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. Found in a complex with POT1; TERF1 and TNKS1.
CC       Component of the shelterin complex (telosome) composed of TERF1,
CC       TERF2, TINF2, TERF2IP, ACD and POT1 (By similarity). Interacts
CC       with TERF1. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19487455}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Chromosome, telomere
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The TBM domain mediates interaction with TERF1.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.

CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   FUNCTION, AND INTERACTION WITH KIFC1 AND NUBP2.
RX   PubMed=16638812; DOI=10.1242/jcs.02922;
RA   Christodoulou A., Lederer C.W., Surrey T., Vernos I., Santama N.;
RT   "Motor protein KIFC5A interacts with Nubp1 and Nubp2, and is
RT   implicated in the regulation of centrosome duplication.";
RL   J. Cell Sci. 119:2035-2047(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the cytosolic iron-sulfur (Fe/S) protein
CC       assembly (CIA) machinery. Required for maturation of
CC       extramitochondrial Fe-S proteins. The NUBP1-NUBP2 heterotetramer
CC       forms a Fe-S scaffold complex, mediating the de novo assembly of
CC       an Fe-S cluster and its transfer to target apoproteins (By
CC       similarity). Implicated in the regulation of centrosome
CC       duplication. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03038,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16638812}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=[4Fe-4S] cluster; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:49883;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03038};
CC       Note=Binds 4 [4Fe-4S] clusters per heterotetramer. Contains two
CC       stable clusters in the N-termini of NUBP1 and two labile, bridging
CC       clusters between subunits of the NUBP1-NUBP2 heterotetramer.
CC       {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03038};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterotetramer of 2 NUBP1 and 2 NUBP2 chains. Interacts
CC       with KIFC1. Interacts with NUBP2. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03038, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16638812}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03038}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: NIH3T3 cells expressing reduced levels of Nubp1
CC       show an increase in number of centrosomes per cell and an increase
CC       in the fraction of multinucleated cells.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the Mrp/NBP35 ATP-binding proteins family.
CC       NUBP1/NBP35 subfamily. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03038}.

RP   INTERACTION WITH KIFC1 AND NUBP2, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=16638812; DOI=10.1242/jcs.02922;
RA   Christodoulou A., Lederer C.W., Surrey T., Vernos I., Santama N.;
RT   "Motor protein KIFC5A interacts with Nubp1 and Nubp2, and is
RT   implicated in the regulation of centrosome duplication.";
RL   J. Cell Sci. 119:2035-2047(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the cytosolic iron-sulfur (Fe/S) protein
CC       assembly (CIA) machinery. Required for maturation of
CC       extramitochondrial Fe-S proteins. The NUBP1-NUBP2 heterotetramer
CC       forms a Fe-S scaffold complex, mediating the de novo assembly of
CC       an Fe-S cluster and its transfer to target apoproteins.
CC       {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03039}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=[4Fe-4S] cluster; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:49883;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03039};
CC       Note=Binds 4 [4Fe-4S] clusters per heterotetramer. Contains two
CC       stable clusters in the N-termini of NUBP1 and two labile, bridging
CC       clusters between subunits of the NUBP1-NUBP2 heterotetramer.
CC       {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03039};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterotetramer of 2 NUBP1 and 2 NUBP2 chains. Interacts
CC       with KIFC1. Interacts with NUBP1. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03039, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16638812}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03039,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16638812}. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, microtubule
CC       organizing center, centrosome {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03039,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16638812}. Note=Enriched at the centrosomes
CC       during mitosis.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed at 7, 11, 15 and 17 dpc.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the Mrp/NBP35 ATP-binding proteins family.
CC       NUBP2/CFD1 subfamily. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03039}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Plays a central role in 2-thiolation of mcm(5)S(2)U at
CC       tRNA wobble positions of tRNA(Lys), tRNA(Glu) and tRNA(Gln).
CC       Directly binds tRNAs and probably acts by catalyzing adenylation
CC       of tRNAs, an intermediate required for 2-thiolation. It is unclear
CC       whether it acts as a sulfurtransferase that transfers sulfur from
CC       thiocarboxylated URM1 onto the uridine of tRNAs at wobble
CC       position. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03053}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: tRNA modification; 5-methoxycarbonylmethyl-2-thiouridine-
CC       tRNA biosynthesis. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03053}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of a complex at least composed of URM1,
CC       CTU2/NCS2 and CTU1/ATPBD3. May form a heterodimer with CTU2/NCS2.
CC       {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03053}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03053}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TtcA family. CTU1/NCS6/ATPBD3
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03053}.

RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;

RN   [9]
RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=23108400; DOI=10.1038/onc.2012.485;
RA   Hagemann N., Ackermann N., Christmann J., Brier S., Yu F.,
RA   Erdmann K.S.;
RT   "The serologically defined colon cancer antigen-3 interacts with the
RT   protein tyrosine phosphatase PTPN13 and is involved in the regulation
RT   of cytokinesis.";
RL   Oncogene 32:4602-4613(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: GTPase-activating protein for the ADP ribosylation
CC       factor family. May serve as a scaffold to bring together molecules
CC       to form signaling modules controlling vesicle trafficking,
CC       adhesion and cytoskeletal organization. Increases the speed of
CC       cell migration, as well as the size and rate of formation of
CC       protrusions, possibly by targeting PAK1 to adhesions and the
CC       leading edge of lamellipodia. Sequesters inactive non-tyrosine-
CC       phosphorylated paxillin in cytoplasmic complexes (By similarity).
CC       Involved in the regulation of cytokinesis; the function may
CC       involve SDCCAG3 and PTPN13 (PubMed:23108400). {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23108400}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with G protein-coupled receptor kinases:
CC       ADRBK1/GRK2, PPFIA1 and PPFIA4, with ARHGEF6/alpha-PIX, with
CC       ARHGEF7/beta-PIX, with PXN/paxillin and with PTK2/FAK1. Component
CC       of cytoplasmic complexes, which also contain PXN, ARHGEF6 and
CC       PAK1. Interacts with SCRIB (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       TGFB1I1. Interacts with SDCCAG3 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9Y2X7, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12153727}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q9ES28:Arhgef7; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-645933, EBI-642580;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Note=Cycles between
CC       at least 3 distinct intracellular compartments, including focal
CC       adhesions, cytoplasmic complexes and membrane protrusions. During
CC       cell migration, when cells detach, moves from the adhesions into
CC       the cytoplasmic complexes towards the leading edge, while, when
CC       cells adhere, it is found in vinculin-containing adhesions.
CC       Recruitment to adhesions may be mediated by active tyrosine-
CC       phosphorylated paxillin (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on tyrosine residues by PTK2/FAK1 and SRC in
CC       growing fibroblasts. Tyrosine-phosphorylation is increased
CC       following cell spreading on fibronectin, decreased in cells
CC       arrested in mitosis and increased in the ensuing G1 phase (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 3 ANK repeats. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00023}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 Arf-GAP domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00288}.

RP   IDENTIFICATION IN THE 19S PROTEASOME REGULATORY COMPLEX.
RX   PubMed=16857966; DOI=10.1161/01.RES.0000237386.98506.f7;
RA   Gomes A.V., Zong C., Edmondson R.D., Li X., Stefani E., Zhang J.,

RN   [7]
RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT THR-250, AND IDENTIFICATION
RP   BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=17242355; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0609836104;
RA   Villen J., Beausoleil S.A., Gerber S.A., Gygi S.P.;
RT   "Large-scale phosphorylation analysis of mouse liver.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 104:1488-1493(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Binds and presumably selects ubiquitin-conjugates for
CC       destruction.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The 26S proteasome is composed of a core protease, known
CC       as the 20S proteasome, capped at one or both ends by the 19S
CC       regulatory complex (RC). The RC is composed of at least 18
CC       different subunits in two subcomplexes, the base and the lid,
CC       which form the portions proximal and distal to the 20S proteolytic
CC       core, respectively. Directly interacts with NUB1. Interacts with
CC       SQSTM1. Interacts with UBQLN4 (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       UBE3A (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=5;
CC       Name=Rpn10A;
CC         IsoId=O35226-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=Rpn10B;
CC         IsoId=O35226-2; Sequence=VSP_005293;
CC       Name=Rpn10C;
CC         IsoId=O35226-3; Sequence=VSP_005293, VSP_005294, VSP_005295;
CC       Name=Rpn10D;
CC         IsoId=O35226-4; Sequence=VSP_005296, VSP_005297;
CC       Name=Rpn10E;
CC         IsoId=O35226-5; Sequence=VSP_005298, VSP_005299;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Isoform Rpn10A is ubiquitous whereas isoform
CC       Rpn10E is mostly expressed in the embryonic brain.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Isoform Rpn10E is expressed only in the
CC       embryos.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The 2 UIM motifs are involved in the binding to a multi-
CC       ubiquitin chain in a cooperative way. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the proteasome subunit S5A family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 UIM (ubiquitin-interacting motif) domains.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00213}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 VWFA domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00219}.

RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=19131326; DOI=10.1074/mcp.M800451-MCP200;
RA   Sweet S.M., Bailey C.M., Cunningham D.L., Heath J.K., Cooper H.J.;
RT   "Large scale localization of protein phosphorylation by use of
RT   electron capture dissociation mass spectrometry.";
RL   Mol. Cell. Proteomics 8:904-912(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Cytoskeletal protein required for organization of normal
CC       actin cytoskeleton. Roles in establishing cell morphology,
CC       motility, cell adhesion and cell-extracellular matrix interactions
CC       in a variety of cell types. May function as a scaffolding molecule
CC       with the potential to influence both actin polymerization and the
CC       assembly of existing actin filaments into higher-order arrays.
CC       Binds to proteins that bind to either monomeric or filamentous
CC       actin. Localizes at sites where active actin remodeling takes
CC       place, such as lamellipodia and membrane ruffles. Different
CC       isoforms may have functional differences. Involved in the control
CC       of morphological and cytoskeletal changes associated with
CC       dendritic cell maturation. Involved in targeting ACTN to specific
CC       May be required for the initiation of neural tube closure.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10931874, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15950489,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16492705, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17115415}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with ACTN, ARGBP2, LPP, PFN1, SPIN90, SRC and
CC       EZR (By similarity). Interacts with EPS8, LASP1 and VASP.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14983521,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16492705, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16868024}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10931874}. Cell junction, focal adhesion
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10931874}. Cell projection, ruffle
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10931874}. Cell projection, lamellipodium
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10931874}. Cytoplasm, myofibril, sarcomere, Z
CC       line {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10931874}. Note=Localizes to stress
CC       fibers and Z lines.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=6;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=200 kDa isoform;
CC         IsoId=Q9ET54-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9ET54-2; Sequence=VSP_027934, VSP_027935, VSP_027936;
CC       Name=3; Synonyms=90 kDa isoform, 3Ig isoform;
CC         IsoId=Q9ET54-3; Sequence=VSP_027932, VSP_027935;
CC       Name=4; Synonyms=140 kDa isoform, 4Ig isoform;
CC         IsoId=Q9ET54-4; Sequence=VSP_027933, VSP_027935;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=Q9ET54-5; Sequence=VSP_027931;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=6;
CC         IsoId=Q9ET54-6; Sequence=VSP_027935;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in both muscle and non-muscle tissues
CC       and cells (at protein level). Isoform 3 is widely expressed,
CC       isoform 4 is particularly abundant in tissues rich in smooth
CC       muscle and in the cardiac muscle and isoform 1 is detected in
CC       heart. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10931874, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11438925}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Ubiquitously detected in embryonic tissues,
CC       and down-regulated in certain adult tissues (at protein level).
CC       Isoform 3 is widely expressed in embryonic tissues (at protein
CC       level). In adults is detected in spleen and gut, and is almost
CC       undetectable in heart, skeletal muscle, liver, and kidney (at
CC       protein level). Isoform 4 is widely expressed in neonatal tissues
CC       (brain, heart, lung, stomach, intestine, kidney, bone and skin)
CC       (at protein level). Late in development expression is restricted
CC       to cardiac muscle and to organs rich in smooth muscle (at protein
CC       level). Isoform 1 is detected in neonatal striated muscle and
CC       bone, and remains highly expressed in adult skeletal and cardiac
CC       muscle (at protein level). Adult brain express an isoform of 80-85
CC       kDa. At E8.5 is mainly expressed the rostral and caudal part of
CC       neural plate. No expression is detected in somite. At E9.5 and
CC       E10.5 is ubiquitously detected. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10931874,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15950489}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated predominantly on serines and, to a lesser
CC       extent, on tyrosines. Phosphorylation at Ser-1143 by PKB/AKT1
CC       modulates cytoskeletal organization and cell motility (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Death around E15.5 due to severe neural tube
CC       closure defects and herniation of liver and intestine. Palld-
CC       deficient mouse embryonic fibroblasts display disorganized actin
CC       cytoskeleton, decreased polymerized filament actin, and decreased
CC       cell adhesion and compromised cell spreading on various
CC       extracellular matrix. Mice embryos lacking Palld exhibit defects
CC       in erythropoiesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15950489,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17115415, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17431131}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the myotilin/palladin family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 5 Ig-like C2-type (immunoglobulin-like)
CC       domains. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AK031696; Type=Frameshift; Positions=821; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=BAB26871.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RP   TISSUE SPECIFICITY, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=14681198; DOI=10.1095/biolreprod.103.022947;
RA   Wallace A.M., Denison T.L., Attaya E.N., MacDonald C.C.;
RT   "Developmental distribution of the polyadenylation protein CstF-64 and
RT   the variant tauCstF-64 in mouse and rat testis.";
RL   Biol. Reprod. 70:1080-1087(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: One of the multiple factors required for polyadenylation
CC       and 3'-end cleavage of mammalian pre-mRNAs. This subunit is
CC       directly involved in the binding to pre-mRNAs (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The CSTF complex is composed of CSTF1 (50 kDa subunit),
CC       CSTF2 (64 kDa subunit) and CSTF3 (77 kDa subunit). CSTF2 directly
CC       interacts with CSTF3, SYMPK and RPO2TC1. Interacts with HSF1 in
CC       heat-stressed cells (By similarity). Interacts with CPSF2, CPSF3
CC       and FIP1L1. Interacts with DDX1 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14681198}.
CC       Note=Localized with DDX1 in cleavage bodies. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8BIQ5-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q8BIQ5-2; Sequence=VSP_014844, VSP_014845;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in most somatic cell types (at
CC       protein level). Highly expressed in testis, except in meiotic
CC       spermatocytes. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11369601,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:14681198}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Up-regulated during the G to S phase transition.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9736695}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 RRM (RNA recognition motif) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00176}.

RP   REVIEW ON FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=20950133; DOI=10.1089/jir.2010.0057;
RA   Onoguchi K., Yoneyama M., Fujita T.;

RN   [15]
RP   REVIEW ON FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=21496944; DOI=10.1016/j.ejcb.2011.01.015;
RA   Schmidt A., Rothenfusser S., Hopfner K.P.;
RT   "Sensing of viral nucleic acids by RIG-I: from translocation to
RT   translation.";
RL   Eur. J. Cell Biol. 91:78-85(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Innate immune receptor which acts as a cytoplasmic
CC       sensor of viral nucleic acids and plays a major role in sensing
CC       viral infection and in the activation of a cascade of antiviral
CC       responses including the induction of type I interferons and
CC       proinflammatory cytokines. Its ligands include: 5'-
CC       triphosphorylated ssRNA and dsRNA and short dsRNA (<1 kb in
CC       length). In addition to the 5'-triphosphate moiety, blunt-end base
CC       pairing at the 5'-end of the RNA is very essential. Overhangs at
CC       the non-triphosphorylated end of the dsRNA RNA have no major
CC       impact on its activity. A 3'overhang at the 5'triphosphate end
CC       decreases and any 5'overhang at the 5' triphosphate end abolishes
CC       its activity. Upon ligand binding it associates with mitochondria
CC       antiviral signaling protein (MAVS/IPS1) which activates the IKK-
CC       related kinases: TBK1 and IKBKE which phosphorylate interferon
CC       regulatory factors: IRF3 and IRF7 which in turn activate
CC       transcription of antiviral immunological genes, including
CC       interferons (IFNs); IFN-alpha and IFN-beta. Detects both positive
CC       and negative strand RNA viruses including members of the families
CC       Paramyxoviridae: newcastle disease virus (NDV) and Sendai virus
CC       (SeV), Rhabdoviridae: vesicular stomatitis virus (VSV),
CC       Orthomyxoviridae: influenza A and B virus, Flaviviridae: Japanese
CC       encephalitis virus (JEV), hepatitis C virus (HCV), dengue virus
CC       (DENV) and west Nile virus (WNV). It also detects rotavirus and
CC       orthoreovirus. Also involved in antiviral signaling in response to
CC       viruses containing a dsDNA genome such as Epstein-Barr virus
CC       (EBV). Detects dsRNA produced from non-self dsDNA by RNA
CC       polymerase III, such as Epstein-Barr virus-encoded RNAs (EBERs).
CC       May play important roles in granulocyte production and
CC       differentiation, bacterial phagocytosis and in the regulation of
CC       cell migration. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16039576,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16625202, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17942531,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19576794, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19609254,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19631370}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + H(2)O = ADP + phosphate.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Zn(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29105; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer; maintained as a monomer in an autoinhibited
CC       state. Upon viral dsRNA binding and conformation shift,
CC       homomultimerizes and interacts (via tandem CARD domain) with
CC       MAVS/IPS1 promoting its filamentation. Interacts with DHX58/LGP2,
CC       IKBKE, TBK1 and TMEM173/STING (By similarity). Interacts (via CARD
CC       domain) with TRIM25 (via SPRY domain). Interacts with CYLD.
CC       Interacts with RNF135 (By similarity). Interacts with CYLD.
CC       Interacts with NLRC5; blocks the interaction of MAVS/IPS1 to
CC       DDX58. Interacts with SRC (By similarity). Interacts with protein
CC       Z of Machupo virus and Junin arenavirus. This interaction disrupts
CC       its interaction with MAVS/IPS1, impeding downstream IRF3 and NF-
CC       kappa-B activation and resulting in decreased IFN-beta induction.
CC       Interacts with Rotavirus A non-structural protein 1 (NSP1) and
CC       this interaction induces down-regulation of DDX58/RIG-I (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with DDX60 (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       ZC3HAV1 (via zinc-fingers) in an RNA-dependent manner (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O95786}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P22682:Cbl; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-6841237, EBI-640919;
CC       Q80ZE3:Siglecg; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-6841237, EBI-6841023;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Cell projection,
CC       ruffle membrane {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Cell junction, tight junction {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Colocalized with TRIM25 at cytoplasmic perinuclear bodies.
CC       Associated with the actin cytoskeleton at membrane ruffles.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=4;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q6Q899-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q6Q899-2; Sequence=VSP_016055, VSP_016060;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q6Q899-3; Sequence=VSP_016058, VSP_016059;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=Q6Q899-4; Sequence=VSP_016056, VSP_016057;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By interferon (IFN).
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The helicase domain is responsible for dsRNA recognition.
CC       Interacts with IFIT3 (via N-terminus). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The 2 CARD domains are responsible for interaction with
CC       and signaling through MAVS/IPS1 and for association with the actin
CC       cytoskeleton. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The repressor domain controls homomultimerization and
CC       interaction with MAVS/IPS1. In the absence of viral infection, the
CC       protein is maintained as a monomer in an autoinhibited state with
CC       the CARD domains masked through intramolecular interactions
CC       mediated by the repressor domain. Upon binding to viral RNA in the
CC       presence of ATP, the repressor domain induces a conformational
CC       change exposing the CARD domain and promotes dimerization and CARD
CC       interactions with the adapter protein MAVS/IPS1 leading to the
CC       induction of downstream signaling.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The second CARD domain is the primary site for 'Lys-63'-
CC       linked ubiquitination. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: ISGylated. Conjugated to ubiquitin-like protein ISG15 upon
CC       IFN-beta stimulation. ISGylation negatively regulates its function
CC       in antiviral signaling response (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylated, probably by MUL1; inhibiting its
CC       polyubiquitination. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated. Undergoes 'Lys-48'- and 'Lys-63'-linked
CC       ubiquitination. Lys-154 and Lys-164 are critical sites for RNF135-
CC       mediated and TRIM4-mediated ubiquitination. Deubiquitinated by
CC       CYLD, a protease that selectively cleaves 'Lys-63'-linked
CC       ubiquitin chains. Also probably deubiquitinated by USP17L2/USP17
CC       that cleaves 'Lys-48'- and 'Lys-63'-linked ubiquitin chains and
CC       positively regulates the receptor (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O95786}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Death between E12.5 and E14 due to liver
CC       apoptosis. Those who are born alive show growth retardation and
CC       die within 3 weeks. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16625202}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the helicase family. RLR subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 CARD domains. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 helicase ATP-binding domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00541}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 helicase C-terminal domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00542}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Binds to the plus end of microtubules and regulates
CC       microtubule dynamics and microtubule organization. Promotes
CC       cytoplasmic microtubule nucleation and elongation. Plays a major
CC       role in organizing spindle poles (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with TACC1. Interacts with SLAIN2 (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, microtubule
CC       organizing center, centrosome {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton, spindle pole {ECO:0000250}. Note=Detected on
CC       centrosomes during interphase. Detected on spindle poles and
CC       microtubules during mitosis (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Ser/Thr-kinase component of cyclin D-CDK4 (DC) complexes
CC       that phosphorylate and inhibit members of the retinoblastoma (RB)
CC       protein family including RB1 and regulate the cell-cycle during
CC       G(1)/S transition. Phosphorylation of RB1 allows dissociation of
CC       the transcription factor E2F from the RB/E2F complexes and the
CC       subsequent transcription of E2F target genes which are responsible
CC       for the progression through the G(1) phase. Hypophosphorylates RB1
CC       in early G(1) phase. Cyclin D-CDK4 complexes are major integrators
CC       of various mitogenenic and antimitogenic signals. Also
CC       phosphorylates SMAD3 in a cell-cycle-dependent manner and
CC       represses its transcriptional activity. Component of the ternary
CC       complex, cyclin D/CDK4/CDKN1B, required for nuclear translocation
CC       and activity of the cyclin D-CDK4 complex (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:1423597}.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Both phosphorylation at Thr-172 and binding of
CC       a D-type cyclin are necessary for enzymatic activity. Full
CC       activation of the cyclin-D-CDK4 complex appears to require other
CC       factors such as recruitment of the substrate via a substrate
CC       recruitment motif, and/or formation of the CDKN1B ternary complex.
CC       Inhibited by INK4 family members. In resting cells, the non-
CC       tyrosine-phosphorylated form of CDKN1B prevents phosphorylation at
CC       Thr-172 and inactivation, while, in proliferating cells, tyrosine
CC       phosphorylation of CDKN1B allows phosphorylation of Thr-172 of
CC       CDK4 and subsequennt activation.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the D-CDK4 complex, composed of CDK4 and
CC       some D-type G1 cyclin (CCND1, CCND2 or CCND3). Interacts directly
CC       in the complex with CCND1, CCND2 or CCND3. Interacts with ZNF655.
CC       Forms a ternary complex, cyclin D-CDK4-CDKN1B, involved in
CC       modulating CDK4 enzymatic activity. Interacts directly with CDKN1B
CC       (phosphorylated on 'Tyr-88' and 'Tyr-89'); the interaction allows
CC       assembly of the cyclin D-CDK4 complex, Thr-172 phosphorylation,
CC       nuclear translocation and enhances the cyclin D-CDK4 complex
CC       activity. CDK4 activity is either inhibited or enhanced depending
CC       on stoichiometry of complex. The non-tyrosine-phosphorylated form
CC       of CDKN1B prevents T-loop phosphorylation of CDK4 producing
CC       inactive CDK4. Interacts (unphosphorylated form) with CDK2. Also
CC       forms ternary complexes with CDKN1A or CDKN2A. Interacts directly
CC       with CDKN1A (via its N-terminal); the interaction promotes the
CC       assembly of the cyclin D-CDK4 complex, its nuclear translocation
CC       and promotes the cyclin D-dependent enzyme activity of CDK4.
CC       Interacts with CCND1; the interaction is prevented with the
CC       binding of CCND1 to INSM1 during cell cycle progression (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with SEI1 and CCND1. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10580009, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19767775}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P24385:CCND1 (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-847225, EBI-375001;
CC       P25322:Ccnd1; NbExp=13; IntAct=EBI-847225, EBI-847243;
CC       P06400:RB1 (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-847225, EBI-491274;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Membrane {ECO:0000250}. Note=Cytoplasmic when non-
CC       complexed. Forms a cyclin D-CDK4 complex in the cytoplasm as cells
CC       progress through G(1) phase. The complex accumulates on the
CC       nuclear membrane and enters the nucleus on transition from G(1) to
CC       S phase. Also present in nucleoli and heterochromatin lumps.
CC       Colocalizes with RB1 after release into the nucleus (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylation at Thr-172 is required for enzymatic
CC       activity. Phosphorylated, in vitro, at this site by CCNH-CDK7,
CC       but, in vivo, appears to be phosphorylated by a proline-directed
CC       kinase. In the cyclin D-CDK4-CDKN1B complex, this phosphorylation
CC       and consequent CDK4 enzyme activity, is dependent on the tyrosine
CC       phosphorylation state of CDKN1B. Thus, in proliferating cells,
CC       CDK4 within the complex is phosphorylated on Thr-172 in the T-
CC       loop. In resting cells, phosphorylation on Thr-172 is prevented by
CC       the non-tyrosine-phosphorylated form of CDKN1B (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. CMGC
CC       Ser/Thr protein kinase family. CDC2/CDKX subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 protein kinase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00159}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-328, AND IDENTIFICATION BY
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acts both as coactivator and as corepressor. May play a
CC       role in chromatin remodeling. Transcriptional corepressor that
CC       down-regulates the expression of target genes. Binds to target
CC       promoters, leading to increased histone H3 acetylation at 'Lys-9'
CC       (H3K9ac). Binds to the ESR1 promoter. Recruits BRCA1 and POU2F1 to
CC       the ESR1 promoter. Coactivator for TP53-mediated activation of
CC       transcription of a set of target genes. Required for TP53-mediated
CC       cell-cycle arrest in response to oncogene activation. Promotes
CC       acetylation of TP53 at 'Lys-382', and thereby promotes efficient
CC       recruitment of TP53 to target promoters. Inhibits cell cycle
CC       progression from G1 to S phase (By similarity). Activator of the
CC       Wnt signaling pathway in a DVL1-dependent manner by negatively
CC       regulating the GSK3B phosphotransferase activity. Induces
CC       dephosphorylation of GSK3B at 'Tyr-216'. Down-regulates TRIM24-
CC       mediated activation of transcriptional activation by AR.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12941796,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18809673, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19909775}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with IRF2 and HNRPUL1 (By similarity).
CC       Interacts (via N-terminus) with TP53. Interacts (via C-terminus)
CC       with EP300. Interacts with BRCA1. Interacts (via bromo domain)
CC       with histone H3 (via N-terminus) acetylated at 'Lys-14' (H3K14ac).
CC       Has low affinity for histone H3 acetylated at 'Lys-9' (H3K9ac).
CC       Has the highest affinity for histone H3 that is acetylated both at
CC       'Lys-9' (H3K9ac) and at 'Lys-14' (H3K14ac). Has very low affinity
CC       for non-acetylated histone H3. Interacts (via bromo domain) with
CC       histone H4 (via N-terminus) acetylated at 'Lys-8' (H3K8ac) (in
CC       vitro) (By similarity). Interacts with TRIM24, PTPN13 and DVL1.
CC       Identified in a complex with SMARCA4/BRG1, SMARCC1/BAF155,
CC       SMARCE1/BAF57, DPF2/BAF45D and ARID2, subunits of the SWI/SNF-B
CC       (PBAF) chromatin remodeling complex. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10526152, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12941796,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18809673, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19909775}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P26450:Pik3r1; NbExp=11; IntAct=EBI-643930, EBI-641764;
CC       O08908:Pik3r2; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-643930, EBI-643570;
CC       Q64512:Ptpn13; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-643930, EBI-4284057;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10526152,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19909775}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitous. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10526152}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed ubiquitously from 10.5 to 18.5 dpc.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10526152}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 bromo domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00035}.
